snippet: With the announcement that a second nurse in Dallas had been infected, scrutiny of Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital intensified as officials sought to calm workers and patients.
abstract: Scrutiny of Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital intensifies as officials seek to calm workers and patients after second nurse Amber Joy Vinson is confirmed to have Ebola virus; there has been no comprehensive investigation to date of the hospital's missteps, but Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services and Texas Dept of State Health Services are evaluating the hospital's performance.

byline.contributor: Sabrina Tavernise contributed reporting from Washington, and Ian Lovett from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: With the announcement that a second nurse in Dallas had been infected, scrutiny of Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital intensified as officials sought to calm workers and patients.

headline.main: Downfall for Hospital Where Ebola Spread
headline.print_headline: Downfall for Hospital Where the Virus Spread

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
